alert.note: Alert for Banner (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 26 at 8:30PM CDT until June 26 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Northeastern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 800 PM MDT. * At 729 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Albin, or 22 miles northwest of Kimball, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Banner and northeastern Laramie Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
